speaker: MENAS
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: SCENE I. A plain in Syria.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Enter VENTIDIUS as it were in triumph, with SILIUS,  and other Romans, Officers, and Soldiers; the dead body of PACORUS borne before him

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Now, darting Parthia, art thou struck; and now

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Pleased fortune does of Marcus Crassus' death

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Make me revenger. Bear the king's son's body

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Before our army. Thy Pacorus, Orodes,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Pays this for Marcus Crassus.

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Noble Ventidius,

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Whilst yet with Parthian blood thy sword is warm,

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: The fugitive Parthians follow; spur through Media,

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Mesopotamia, and the shelters whither

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: The routed fly: so thy grand captain Antony

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Shall set thee on triumphant chariots and

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Put garlands on thy head.

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: O Silius, Silius,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: I have done enough; a lower place, note well,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: May make too great an act: for learn this, Silius;

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Better to leave undone, than by our deed

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Acquire too high a fame when him we serve's away.

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Caesar and Antony have ever won

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: More in their officer than person: Sossius,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: One of my place in Syria, his lieutenant,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: For quick accumulation of renown,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Which he achieved by the minute, lost his favour.

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Who does i' the wars more than his captain can

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Becomes his captain's captain: and ambition,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: The soldier's virtue, rather makes choice of loss,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Than gain which darkens him.

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: I could do more to do Antonius good,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: But 'twould offend him; and in his offence

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Should my performance perish.

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Thou hast, Ventidius,

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: that

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Without the which a soldier, and his sword,

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Grants scarce distinction. Thou wilt write to Antony!

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: I'll humbly signify what in his name,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: That magical word of war, we have effected;

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: How, with his banners and his well-paid ranks,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: The ne'er-yet-beaten horse of Parthia

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: We have jaded out o' the field.

speaker: SILIUS
text_entry: Where is he now?

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: He purposeth to Athens: whither, with what haste

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: The weight we must convey with's will permit,

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: We shall appear before him. On there; pass along!

speaker: VENTIDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
